sen.j: 出挙（すいこ）は、古代～中世の日本に見られた利子付き貸借を指す用語。
sen.e: Suiko (government loans made to peasants) was a jargon that indicated the loan carrying interest observed in the ancient and medieval Japan.
Suiko (government loans made to peasants) was a term that indicated the loans carrying interest observed in ancient and medieval Japan.
Suiko (government loans made to peasants) was a term that indicated the loans carrying interest observed in ancient and medieval Japan.

sen.j: 世界各地の農業社会では、その初期の頃から、播種期に種子を貸与し、収穫期に利子を付けて返済させる慣行が生まれたと考えられている。
sen.e: In the agrarian society worldwide, it is thought that a system, in which seeds were loaned to peasants in the planting season to make them pay back the loaned seeds and the born interest in the harvesting season, was launched in the early days.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In the agrarian society worldwide, it is thought that a system, in which seeds were loaned to peasants in the planting season to make them pay back the loaned seeds and the born interest in the harvesting season, was launched in the early days.

In the agrarian society worldwide, it is thought that a system, in which seeds were loaned to peasants in the planting season to make them pay back the loaned seeds and the born interest in the harvesting season, was launched in the early days.

sen.j: （これを利子の起源とする意見もある。)
sen.e: (An opinion suggests this was the origin of interest.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: (An opinion suggests this was the origin of interest.)
(An opinion suggests this was the origin of interest.)

sen.j: 中国では古くから利子付き貸借の慣習が存在したとされているが、日本でも古代からそうした慣習が発生していたのではないかと見られている。
sen.e: While a system of loaning is believed to have existed in China since long ago, similar system may have existed in Japan as well since ancient times, it is speculated.
While a system of loaning is believed to have existed in China since long ago, a similar system may have existed in Japan as well since ancient times, it is speculated.
While a system of loaning is believed to have existed in China since long ago, a similar system may have existed in Japan as well since ancient times, it is speculated.

sen.j: 日本書紀の孝徳天皇2年（646年）3月19日の記事に「貸稲」（いらしのいね）の語が登場する。
sen.e: The word 'Irashi no ine' (literally, loaning rice plant) appears in the article of April 12, 646 in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
The word 'Irashi no ine' (literally, loaning rice plant) appears in the article of April 12, 646 in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
The word 'Irashi no ine' (literally, loaning rice plant) appears in the article of April 12, 646 in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

sen.j: これが出挙の前身ではないかと考えられており、少なくとも7世紀中期までに利子の慣行が発生していたことの傍証とされている。
sen.e: This is believed to be the predecessor of Suiko, regarded as a corroboration of the opinion that a system charging and paying interest had already existed by the middle of the seventh century at the latest.

This is believed to be the predecessor of Suiko, regarded as a corroboration of the opinion that a system charging and paying interest had already existed by the middle of the seventh century at the latest.

This is believed to be the predecessor of Suiko, regarded as a corroboration of the opinion that a system charging and paying interest had already existed by the middle of the seventh century at the latest.

sen.j: （日本書紀の記述に懐疑的な意見もある。）
sen.e: (There is also a skeptic opinion about the description in Nihonshoki.)
sen.cmt: 次のセルから)を移動しました。
sen.e: (There is also a skeptic opinion about the description in Nihonshoki.)
(There is also a skeptic opinion about the description in Nihonshoki.)

sen.j: 8世紀に施行された律令に初めて「出挙」の語が現れた（養老律令雑令）。
sen.e: The word 'Suiko' first appeared in the Ritsuryo codes enforced in the eighth century (Yoro-ritsuryo-zoryo (a chapter in the code promulgated in the Yoro period dealing with miscellaneous materials)).
The word 'Suiko' first appeared in the Ritsuryo codes enforced in the eighth century (Yoro-ritsuryo-zoryo (a chapter in the code promulgated in the Yoro period dealing with miscellaneous materials)).
The word 'Suiko' first appeared in the Ritsuryo codes enforced in the eighth century (Yoro-ritsuryo-zoryo [a chapter in the code promulgated in the Yoro period dealing with miscellaneous materials]).
sen.cmt: カッコ内のカッコを修正しました。

sen.j: 従前から日本でも利子付き貸借の慣行が存在していたと考えられている。
sen.e: The system of loaning is widely believed to have already existed in Japan before the enforcement of the Yoro-ritsuryo-zoryo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The system of loaning is widely believed to have already existed in Japan before the enforcement of the Yoro-ritsuryo-zoryo.
The system of loaning is widely believed to have already existed in Japan before the enforcement of the Yoro-ritsuryo-zoryo.

sen.j: しかし、律令上に出挙が明確に規定されることによって、利子付き貸借が国家により制度化されたのだと解釈されている。
sen.e: However, stipulating the Suiko in the Ritsuryo codes is considered that the system of loaning was institutionalized by the government.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, stipulating the Suiko in the Ritsuryo codes is considered that the system of loaning was institutionalized by the government.
However, stipulating the Suiko in the Ritsuryo codes is considered that the system of loaning was institutionalized by the government.

sen.j: （出挙の制度化には、唐の影響を指摘する意見もある）。
sen.e: (There is also an opinion pointing out the influence of Tang Dynasty on the institutionalization of Suiko.)
(There is also an opinion pointing out the influence of the Tang Dynasty on the institutionalization of Suiko.)
(There is also an opinion pointing out the influence of the Tang Dynasty on the institutionalization of Suiko.)

sen.j: 出挙は元々、農業生産の推進・奨励、すなわち勧農の一つとして位置づけられていた。
sen.e: Suiko was originally regarded as a system to promote and encourage the agricultural production, namely a kind of encouraging the agriculture.
Suiko was originally regarded as a system to promote and encourage agricultural production, namely a kind of encouraging of agriculture.
Suiko was originally regarded as a system to promote and encourage agricultural production, namely a kind of encouraging of agriculture.

sen.j: 律令制においては、公的な出挙（公出挙：くすいこ）・私的な出挙（私出挙：しすいこ）に区分された。
sen.e: Suiko was divided into two groups under the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the Ritsuryo codes): one was the official Suiko (Ku-Suiko) and the other was the private Suiko (Shi-Suiko).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Suiko was divided into two groups under the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the Ritsuryo codes): one was the official Suiko (Ku-Suiko) and the other was the private Suiko (Shi-Suiko).

Suiko was divided into two groups under the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the Ritsuryo codes): one was the official Suiko (Ku-Suiko) and the other was the private Suiko (Shi-Suiko).

sen.j: また、財物を出挙した場合と稲粟を出挙した場合で取扱いが異なっていた。
sen.e: Furthermore, the Suiko dealing with property and that dealing with rice and millet were transacted in a different way.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Furthermore, the Suiko dealing with property and that dealing with rice and millet were transacted in different ways.
Furthermore, the Suiko dealing with property and that dealing with rice and millet were transacted in different ways.

sen.j: 具体的な内容は次のとおりである。
sen.e: The following are the details of Suiko.
The following are the details of Suiko.
The following are the details of Suiko.

sen.j: 律令では、まず出挙が私的・自由な契約関係に依るべきであり、官庁の管理を受けないことを共通原則としていた。
sen.e: In the Ritsuryo codes, it was regarded as a common principle that Suiko should be managed in line with the private and free contract relationship, without being managed by the government office.
In the Ritsuryo codes, it was regarded as a common principle that Suiko should be managed in line with the private and free contract relationship, without being managed by the government office.
In the Ritsuryo codes, it was regarded as a common principle that Suiko should be managed in line with the private and free contract relationship, without being managed by the government office.

sen.j: 財物の場合、60日ごとに8分の1ずつ利子を取ることとされた（年利約75％）。
sen.e: In the Suiko dealing with property, one eighth of loan was charged as interest every 60 days (annual interest at about 75%).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In the Suiko dealing with property, one eighth of the loan was charged as interest every 60 days (annual interest at about 75%).
In the Suiko dealing with property, one eighth of the loan was charged as interest every 60 days (annual interest at about 75%).

sen.j: 480日を経過しても元本以上の利子を取ることは認められなかった。
sen.e: However, the creditor was not allowed to charge more interest than the capital sum, even if the term of loaning had passed 480 days.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, the creditor was not allowed to charge more interest than the capital sum, even if the term of loaning had passed 480 days.
However, the creditor was not allowed to charge more interest than the capital sum, even if the term of loaning had passed 480 days.

sen.j: さらに、利子の複利計算も禁じられていた。
sen.e: Furthermore, it was forbidden to calculate the interest by using the compound-interest method.
Furthermore, it was forbidden to calculate the interest by using the compound-interest method.
Furthermore, it was forbidden to calculate the interest by using the compound-interest method.

sen.j: 債務者が逃げたときは、保証人が弁済することも定められていた。
sen.e: It was also provided that the guarantor would be under obligation to pay off the debtor's loan when he ran away.
It was also provided that the guarantor would be under obligation to pay off the debtor's loan when he ran away.
It was also provided that the guarantor would be under obligation to pay off the debtor's loan when he ran away.

sen.j: 稲粟の場合、1年を満期として、私出挙であれば年利100％まで、公出挙であれば年利50％まで利子を取ることが認められていた。
sen.e: In the Suiko dealing with rice and millet, with setting the due date on 1 year, the creditor was allowed to charge the annual interest at 100% at the maximum in Shi-Suiko, while the annual interest at 50% at the maximum in Ku-Suiko.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In the Suiko dealing with rice and millet, with setting the due date one year later, the creditor was allowed to charge a maximum of 100% annual interest in Shi-Suiko, and 50% annual interest at the maximum for Ku-Suiko.

In the Suiko dealing with rice and millet, with setting the due date one year later, the creditor was allowed to charge a maximum of 100% annual interest in Shi-Suiko, and 50% annual interest at the maximum for Ku-Suiko.

sen.j: 財物と同様、複利計算は禁じられていた。
sen.e: Like the Suiko dealing with property, calculation by using the compound-interest method was forbidden.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Like the Suiko dealing with property, calculation by using the compound-interest method was forbidden.
Like the Suiko dealing with property, calculation by using the compound-interest method was forbidden.

sen.j: 財物も稲粟も、非常に高い利子率が設定されているのが特徴的である。
sen.e: It is characteristic that the Suiko dealing with property as well as that dealing with rice and millet charged interest at the extremely high rate.
It is characteristic of the Suiko dealing with property as well as that dealing with rice and millet charged interest at an extremely high rate.
It is characteristic of the Suiko dealing with property as well as that dealing with rice and millet in that it charges interest at an extremely high rate.

sen.j: 稲粟であれば、播種量に対する収穫量の割合が非常に高いため、利子率が著しく高くなるのは合理的だと言える。
sen.e: Regarding the Suiko dealing with rice and millet, quite high interest rate might be reasonable, because the ratio of yield to the seeding stood at very high.
Regarding the Suiko dealing with rice and millet, a high interest rate might be reasonable, because the ratio of yield to the seeding stood very high.
Regarding the Suiko dealing with rice and millet, a high interest rate might be reasonable, because the ratio of yield to the seeding stood very high.

sen.j: しかし、財物についても利子率がかなりの高水準であった。
sen.e: On the other hand, the interest rate in the Suiko dealing with property was also fixed at the considerably high-level.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: On the other hand, the interest rate in the Suiko dealing with property was also fixed at a considerably high-level.
On the other hand, the interest rate in the Suiko dealing with property was also fixed at a considerably high-level.

sen.j: その理由について見解が分かれている。
sen.e: Opinions are divided on the reason.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Opinions are divided on the reason.
Opinions are divided on the reason.

sen.j: 都市部（平城京や平安京）では、財物の出挙が盛んに行われていたようだ。
sen.e: It seems that the Suiko dealing with property was implemented frequently in the urban areas (Heijo-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Nara) and Heian-kyo (ancient capital in current Kyoto)).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It seems that the Suiko dealing with property was implemented frequently in the urban areas (Heijo-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Nara) and Heian-kyo (ancient capital in current Kyoto)).

It seems that the Suiko dealing with property was implemented frequently in the urban areas (Heijo-kyo [the ancient capital of Japan in current Nara] and Heian-kyo [ancient capital in current Kyoto]).
sen.cmt: カッコ内のカッコを修正しました。

sen.j: 平安時代に書かれた日本現報善悪霊異記に、出挙によって金銭亡者となったり返済に苦悩したりする都市住民の様子がまざまざと描かれている。
sen.e: "Nihon genho zenaku ryoiki" (set of three books of Buddhist stories) written in the Heian period vividly depicts the condition of the people living in the urban areas who became money-mad due to Suiko or were suffering from repayment.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: "Nihon genho zenaku ryoiki" (set of three books of Buddhist stories) written in the Heian period vividly depicts the condition of the people living in the urban areas who became money-mad due to Suiko or were suffering from repayment.

"Nihon genho zenaku ryoiki" (set of three books of Buddhist stories) written in the Heian period vividly depicts the condition of the people living in the urban areas who became money-mad due to Suiko or were suffering from repayment.

sen.j: また、正倉院文書の中に出挙の貸借証文が多数のこされており、奈良時代当時の財物出挙の貴重な史料となっている。
sen.e: Moreover, a lot of loan bonds have been left in Shoso-in Monjo (Shoso-in Temple archives), which are the valuable historical materials of the Suiko dealing with property in the Nara period.
Moreover, a lot of loan bonds have been left in Shoso-in Monjo (Shoso-in Temple archives), which are the valuable historical materials of the Suiko dealing with property in the Nara period.
Moreover, a lot of loan bonds have been left in Shoso-in Monjo (Shoso-in Temple archives), which are the valuable historical materials of the Suiko dealing with property in the Nara period.

sen.j: 稲粟の出挙は、主に農村部において盛んに行われた。
sen.e: In general, the Suiko dealing with rice and millet was frequently implemented in the agricultural community.
In general, the Suiko dealing with rice and millet was frequently implemented in the agricultural community.
In general, the Suiko dealing with rice and millet was frequently implemented in the agricultural community.

sen.j: 元々、稲粟の出挙には、百姓の救済や勧農といった意味合いがあった。
sen.e: Originally, the Suiko using rice and millet was aimed at saving peasants and encouraging the agriculture.
Originally, the Suiko using rice and millet was aimed at saving peasants and encouraging agriculture.
Originally, the Suiko using rice and millet was aimed at saving peasants and encouraging agriculture.

sen.j: しかし、公出挙でも年利50％と高利が認められていたので、国府や郡家などの地方機関は春になると正税（租庸調）の種籾を百姓へ強制的に貸与した。
sen.e: However, since charging high annual interest rate at 50% was admitted in Ku-Suiko, local administrative organs such as Kokufu (provincial office) and Gunke (public office) started to forcibly loan seed rice to peasants in spring, although such seed rice should have been stored in provincial offices' warehouse as Shozei, the rice tax (belonging to Soyocho (a tax system, corvee)).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, since charging high annual interest rates at 50% was admitted in Ku-Suiko, local administrative organizations such as the Kokufu (provincial office) and Gunke (public office) started to forcibly loan seed rice to peasants in spring, although such seed rice should have been stored in the provincial offices' warehouse as Shozei, the rice tax (belonging to Soyocho (a tax system, corvee)).

However, since charging high annual interest rates at 50% was admitted even in Ku-Suiko, local administrative organizations such as the Kokufu (provincial office) and Gunke (public office) started to forcibly loan seed rice to peasants in spring, although such seed rice should have been stored in the provincial offices' warehouse as Shozei, the rice tax (belonging to So-Yo-Cho system [a tax system, corvee]).
sen.cmt: カッコ内のカッコを修正しました。租庸調→So-Yo-Cho system としました。

sen.j: 秋になると50％の利息をつけて返済させるようになった。
sen.e: Then, they made peasants pay back the loaned seeds with the interest at 50% in autumn.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Then, they made peasants pay back the loaned seeds with interest at 50% in autumn.
Then, they made peasants pay back the loaned seeds with interest at 50% in autumn.

sen.j: この利息分の稲を利稲（りとう）という。
sen.e: The rice plant paid as interest was called "Rito" (interest of rice plant).
The rice plant paid as interest was called "Rito" (interest of rice plant).
The rice plant paid as interest was called "Rito" (interest of rice plant).

sen.j: 律令上、租税の中でも正税は、地方機関（国府や郡家）の主要財源とされていた。
sen.e: In the Ritsuryo codes, Shozei was regarded as the main financial resources for local administrative organs (Kokufu and Gunke) among various land taxes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In the Ritsuryo codes, Shozei was regarded as the main financial resources for local administrative organizations (Kokufu and Gunke) among various land taxes.
In the Ritsuryo codes, Shozei was regarded as the main financial resources for local administrative organizations (Kokufu and Gunke) among various land taxes.

sen.j: しかし正税徴収には戸籍の作成、百姓への班田など非常に煩雑な事務を必要としていた。
sen.e: However, collecting Shozei needed excessively complicated clerical work such as forming the family register and allotting farmland to peasants (Handen).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, collecting Shozei needed excessively complicated clerical work such as forming the family register and allotting farmland to peasants (Handen).
However, collecting Shozei needed excessively complicated clerical work such as forming the family register and allotting farmland to peasants (Handen).

sen.j: しかし、公出挙であれば、繁雑な事務を行わなくとも多額の収入を確保することができたので、地方機関の多くは百姓に対する強制的な公出挙を行い財源としたのである。
sen.e: On the other hand, Ku-Suiko enabled local administrative organs to secure a large sum of income without troublesome clerical work; therefore, many of those organs implemented forcible Ku-Suiko, exploiting peasants for acquiring the financial resources.

On the other hand, Ku-Suiko enabled local administrative organizations to secure a large sum of income without troublesome clerical work; therefore, many of those organizations implemented forcible Ku-Suiko, exploiting peasants for acquiring financial resources.

On the other hand, Ku-Suiko enabled local administrative organizations to secure a large sum of income without troublesome clerical work; therefore, many of those organizations implemented forcible Ku-Suiko, exploiting peasants for acquiring financial resources.

sen.j: このように、公出挙は租税の一部として位置づけられるようになった。
sen.e: Thus, Ku-Suiko came to be recognized as a part of land tax.
Thus, Ku-Suiko came to be recognized as a part of the land tax.
Thus, Ku-Suiko came to be recognized as a part of the land tax.

sen.j: 公出挙によって、百姓が疲弊し始めたことを知った律令政府は、720年（養老4）3月、公出挙の利子率の低減（年利50％→30％）、そして養老2年以前に生じた全ての債務の免除を決定し、諸国へ通知した。
sen.e: Knowing that peasants gradually became impoverished due to Ku-Suiko, the ancient Japanese government of centralized governance decided in April 720 to reduce the annual interest rate of Ku-Suiko from 50% to 30%, and to forgive all debts born before 718, notifying various districts.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Knowing that peasants gradually became impoverished due to Ku-Suiko, the ancient Japanese government of centralized governance decided in April 720 to reduce the annual interest rate of Ku-Suiko from 50% to 30%, and to forgive all debts born before 718, notifying various districts.

Knowing that peasants gradually became impoverished due to Ku-Suiko, the ancient Japanese government of centralized governance decided in April 720 to reduce the annual interest rate of Ku-Suiko from 50% to 30%, and to forgive all debts born before 718, notifying various districts.

sen.j: しかしほどなくして公出挙の利子率は50％へ戻された。
sen.e: However, the annual interest rate of Ku-Suiko was soon raised to 50% again.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, the annual interest rate of Ku-Suiko was soon raised to 50% again.
However, the annual interest rate of Ku-Suiko was soon raised to 50% again.

sen.j: 更に745年の国司の給与の財源として公廨稲が正税から分離されて、出挙の運用原資として用いられるようになった事で出挙と国司の収入が直接関係するようになった。
sen.e: In addition, regarded as financial resources for provincial governors' salary, Kugaito (local source of revenue) was separated from Shozei in 745 and used as the fund for managing Suiko, which created the direct relationship between the income through Suiko and the provincial governors' salary.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In addition, regarded as financial resources for provincial governors' salary, Kugaito (local source of revenue) was separated from Shozei in 745 and used as the fund for managing Suiko, which created a direct relationship between the income through Suiko and the provincial governors' salary.

In addition, regarded as financial resources for provincial governors' salary, Kugaito (local source of revenue) was separated from Shozei in 745 and used as the fund for managing Suiko, which created a direct relationship between the income through Suiko and the provincial governors' salary.

sen.j: その結果むしろ公出挙は益々盛んになった。
sen.e: As a result, Ku-Suiko came to be implemented more extensively than before.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: As a result, Ku-Suiko came to be implemented more extensively than before.
As a result, Ku-Suiko came to be implemented more extensively than before.

sen.j: その後、奈良末期～平安初頭にかけて桓武天皇が、律令国家の再構築を目指して大規模な行政改革を実行した。
sen.e: Afterwards, aiming at restructuring the nation under the Ritsuryo codes, the Emperor Kanmu carried out a large scale of administrative reform from the late Nara period to the early Heian period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Afterwards, aiming at restructuring the nation under the Ritsuryo codes, the Emperor Kanmu carried out a large scale of administrative reform from the late Nara period to the early Heian period.
Afterwards, aiming at restructuring the nation under the Ritsuryo codes, the Emperor Kanmu carried out a large scale of administrative reform from the late Nara period to the early Heian period.

sen.j: その一環として公出挙の利子率が再び年利30％へ引き下げられることとなった。
sen.e: As a part of the reform, the annual interest rate of Ku-Suiko was reduced to 30% again.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: As a part of the reform, the annual interest rate of Ku-Suiko was reduced to 30% again.
As a part of the reform, the annual interest rate of Ku-Suiko was reduced to 30% again.

tit.e: Suiko in the early Heian period
Suiko in the early Heian period
Suiko in the early Heian period

sen.j: 平安期にはいると、正税と並んで公出挙が主要な地方財源となっていった。
sen.e: Ku-Suiko became the main financial resources for local government along with Shozei in the Heian period.
Ku-Suiko became the main financial resources for local government along with Shozei in the Heian period.
Ku-Suiko became the main financial resources for local government along with Shozei in the Heian period.

sen.j: これに伴い、平安前期の弘仁貞観期（9世紀）には、政府の租税方針も律令が当初想定していた人への課税から土地への課税へと転換した。
sen.e: Therefore, in the Konin-Jogan period in the early Heian period (the ninth century), the taxes policy of the government was converted from taxation on people, which was the initial policy mapped out under the Ritsuryo codes, to the taxation on lands.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Therefore, in the Konin-Jogan period in the early Heian period (the ninth century), the taxes policy of the government was converted from taxation on people, which was the initial policy mapped out under the Ritsuryo codes, to the taxation on lands.

Therefore, in the Konin-Jogan eras in the early Heian period (the ninth century), the taxes policy of the government was converted from taxation on people, which was the initial policy mapped out under the Ritsuryo codes, to the taxation on lands.

sen.j: 例えば、土地に対して公出挙の納入義務が課せられるような事例も見られた。
sen.e: For example, there were cases that the payment duty of Ku-Suiko was imposed on lands.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: For example, there were cases that the payment duty of Ku-Suiko was imposed on lands.
For example, there were cases that the payment duty of Ku-Suiko was imposed on lands.

sen.j: 地方機関の倉庫（正倉）には正税を備蓄し、地方機関が備蓄米を公出挙により運用することとされていた。
sen.e: It was provided that Shozei should be stored in the warehouse (Shoso) of local administrative organs, and that those organs should manage the stored rice through Ku-Suiko.
It was provided that Shozei should be stored in the warehouse (Shoso) of local administrative organizations, and that they should manage the stored rice through Ku-Suiko.
It was provided that Shozei should be stored in the warehouse (Shoso) of local administrative organizations, and that they should manage the stored rice through Ku-Suiko.

sen.j: しかし、公出挙のウェイトが大きくなってくると、地方機関の出挙運用に様々なトラブルが起こるようになり、利稲を確保できない状況も生じていた。
sen.e: With the role of Ku-Suiko increasing, however, various troubles happened in the management of Suiko controlled by local administrative organs, which caused difficulties in securing "Rito."
With the role of Ku-Suiko increasing, however, various troubles occured in the management of Suiko controlled by local administrative organizations, which caused difficulties in securing "Rito."
With the role of Ku-Suiko increasing, however, various troubles occurred in the management of Suiko controlled by local administrative organizations, which caused difficulties in securing Rito.
sen.cmt: Rito のダブルクオーテーションを削除しました。

sen.j: このころには地方機関による公出挙の他、地域の富豪・有力百姓ら（田堵など）も零細百姓らを対象に私出挙を行うようになった。
sen.e: In addition to the Ku-Suiko managed by local administrative organs, rich people and influential farmers such as Tato (cultivators) living in local areas implemented the Shi-Suiko for petty farmers in those days.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In addition to the Ku-Suiko managed by local administrative organizations, rich people and influential farmers such as Tato (cultivators) living in local areas implemented Shi-Suiko for petty farmers in those days.

In addition to the Ku-Suiko managed by local administrative organizations, rich people and influential farmers such as Tato (cultivators) living in local areas implemented Shi-Suiko for petty farmers in those days.

sen.j: 9世紀には広範囲の国で、公出挙と私出挙を組み合わせた租税徴収方法が模索されていた。
sen.e: In the ninth century, many provinces had examined the land tax collecting system by combining the Ku-Suiko with the Shi-Suiko.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In the ninth century, many provinces had examined the land tax collecting system by combining the Ku-Suiko with the Shi-Suiko.
In the ninth century, many provinces had examined the land tax collecting system by combining the Ku-Suiko with the Shi-Suiko.

sen.j: これは、公出挙の貸付先として利払いが滞りがちな小規模広範囲の百姓ではなく、大規模で少数の有力百姓等を指定し、彼らが公出挙により受け取った本稲（元本の稲）を私出挙の財源とすることを認めたものであった。
sen.e: Under this system, local administrative organs designated a small number of influential farmers as debtors, instead of small-scaled and extensive peasants with a tendency of stagnant interest payment, allowing those designated debtors to use the "Honto" (rice plant as the capital), which they had received through Ku-Suiko, for the financial resources of Shi-Suiko.

Under this system, local administrative organizations designated a small number of influential farmers as debtors, instead of small-scaled and extensive peasants with a tendency of stagnant interest payment, allowing those designated debtors to use the "Honto" (rice plant as capital), which they had received through Ku-Suiko, for the financial resources of Shi-Suiko.

Under this system, local administrative organizations designated a small number of influential farmers as debtors, instead of small-scaled and extensive peasants with a tendency of stagnant interest payment, allowing those designated debtors to use the "Honto" (rice plant as capital), which they had received through Ku-Suiko, for the financial resources of Shi-Suiko.

sen.j: 彼らは年利30％で公出挙の本稲を借り受け、年利50％で貸し付けることにより20％の利息を得ることとなった。
sen.e: Borrowing the Honto through Ku-Suiko at 30% interest a year, they lent it at 50%, which brought them in 20% a year.
Borrowing the Honto through Ku-Suiko at 30% interest a year, they lent it at 50%, which brought them in 20% a year.
Borrowing the Honto through Ku-Suiko at 30% interest a year, they lent it at 50%, which brought them in 20% a year.

sen.j: 更に9世紀後半には、地域の富豪・有力百姓らの私倉を正倉と認め（里倉）、彼らに公出挙運用を請け負わせることで、地方機関の出挙収入の確保が図られるようになった。
sen.e: In addition, in the latter half of the ninth century, local administrative organs attempted to secure the income through Suiko by allowing rich people and influential farmers in local areas to undertake the management of Ku-Suiko after admitting the private warehouse possessed by those people to be Shoso (Riso).

In addition, in the latter half of the ninth century, local administrative organizations attempted to secure income through Suiko by allowing rich people and influential farmers in local areas to undertake the management of Ku-Suiko after admitting the private warehouse possessed by those people to be Shoso (Riso).

In addition, in the latter half of the ninth century, local administrative organizations attempted to secure income through Suiko by allowing rich people and influential farmers in local areas to undertake the management of Ku-Suiko after admitting the private warehouse possessed by those people to be Shoso (Riso).

sen.j: これを里倉負名（りそうふみょう）という。
sen.e: This was called the Riso-fumyo system (a percentage/unit of the yearly land tax yield taken in by the manager of an estate).
This was called the Riso-fumyo system (a percentage/unit of the yearly land tax yield taken in by the manager of an estate).
This was called the Riso-fumyo system (a percentage/unit of the yearly land tax yield taken in by the manager of an estate).

sen.j: 里倉負名制では、負名と呼ばれるようになった地域の富豪・有力百姓ら請負人は徴税役人に任命された。
sen.e: In the Riso-fumyo system, undertakers including rich people and influential farmers in local areas, who had come to be called Fumyo (a local tax manager), were appointed to the officials for collecting taxes.

In the Riso-fumyo system, undertakers including rich people and influential farmers in local areas, who had come to be called Fumyo (a local tax manager), were appointed to the officials for collecting taxes.

In the Riso-fumyo system, undertakers including rich people and influential farmers in local areas, who had come to be called Fumyo (a local tax manager), were appointed to the officials for collecting taxes.

sen.j: 負名は、私出挙により得た50％の利子のうち30％分を公出挙の利子として地方機関に納入すれば残りの20％を正倉管理料、運用請負費用等として自分のものとすることが出来た。
sen.e: If Fumyo paid 30% of the total interest of 50% obtained through Shi-Suiko to local administrative organs as interest of Ku-Suiko, they were allowed to keep the remaining 20% for themselves as the management fee of the Shoso and the cost for undertaking the operation, etc.

If Fumyo paid 30% of the total interest of 50% obtained through Shi-Suiko to local administrative organizations as interest for Ku-Suiko, they were allowed to keep the remaining 20% for themselves as a management fee for the Shoso and the cost for undertaking the operation, etc.

If Fumyo paid 30% of the total interest of 50% obtained through Shi-Suiko to local administrative organizations as interest for Ku-Suiko, they were allowed to keep the remaining 20% for themselves as a management fee for the Shoso and the cost for undertaking the operation, etc.

sen.j: このような状況の下、公出挙と不可分の存在となった私出挙も半強制的に行われていた。
sen.e: Under this situation, Shi-Suiko, which had been inseparably linked to Ku-Suiko, were implemented half-forcibly.
Under this situation, Shi-Suiko, which had been inseparably linked to Ku-Suiko, were implemented half-forcibly.
Under this situation, Shi-Suiko, which had been inseparably linked to Ku-Suiko, were implemented half-forcibly.

sen.j: 私出挙においては、借受側の百姓らの宅地・耕地・奴婢などが担保とされていたが、高利のため返済できない例も多かった。
sen.e: In Shi-Suiko, debtors gave the residential lands, cultivated lands, slaves and others as collateral, but not a few of them failed to repay the debts due to the high interest rate.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In Shi-Suiko, debtors gave the residential lands, cultivated lands, slaves and others as collateral, but many failed to repay the debts due to the high interest rate.
In Shi-Suiko, debtors gave the residential lands, cultivated lands, slaves and others as collateral, but many failed to repay the debts due to the high interest rate.

sen.j: 担保物件は貸与側の所有へと移転（質流れ）することとなり、富の集中・蓄積が進んでいった。
sen.e: Therefore, the collateral passed to the lenders, with the result that the concentration and accumulation of wealth advanced.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Therefore, the collateral passed to the lenders, with the result that the concentration and accumulation of wealth advanced.
Therefore, the collateral passed to the lenders, with the result that the concentration and accumulation of wealth advanced.

sen.j: このようにして、平安中期ごろには、富豪層による地域支配が徐々に拡がり始めていき、これが中世の萌芽へつながっていく。
sen.e: Thus, the regional rule by the rich stratum gradually extended in around the mid Heian period, which led to the prosperity of them in the medieval Japan.
Thus, the regional rule by the rich stratum gradually extended in around the mid Heian period, which led to their prosperity in medieval Japan.
Thus, the regional rule by the rich stratum gradually extended in around the mid Heian period, which led to their prosperity in medieval Japan.

sen.j: 延喜年間に里倉負名体制は負名体制に移行し、公的租税としての正税及び公出挙に代わり官物として一括して土地に賦課する方式となった。
sen.e: After the Riso-fumyo system was switched to the Fumyo system (local tax manager system), the tax was comprehensively imposed on lands as Kanmotsu (tribute paid as taxes), instead of Shozei and Ku-Suiko, both of which were regarded as the official land taxes.

After the Riso-fumyo system was switched to the Fumyo system (local tax manager system), the tax was comprehensively imposed on lands as Kanmotsu (tribute paid as taxes), instead of Shozei and Ku-Suiko, both of which were regarded as the official land taxes.

After the Riso-fumyo system was switched to the Fumyo system (local tax manager system), the tax was comprehensively imposed on lands as Kanmotsu (tribute paid as taxes), instead of Shozei and Ku-Suiko, both of which were regarded as the official land taxes.

sen.j: 11世紀中期には官物の税率が公田官物率法により「段別三斗」に固定化され土地税としての性質が強まった。
sen.e: The Koden-kanmotsu-rippo (the law fixing the tax rate of Kanmotsu) fixed the tax rate of the Kanmotsu at 'Danbetsu santo' (54lit. of rice per 10a) in the mid eleventh century, by which Kanmotsu increasingly assumed the characteristics of land tax.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The Koden-kanmotsu-rippo (the law fixing the tax rate of Kanmotsu) fixed the tax rate of the Kanmotsu at 'Danbetsu santo' (54lit. of rice per 10a) in the mid eleventh century, by which Kanmotsu increasingly assumed the characteristics of land tax.

The Koden kanmotsu rippo (the law fixing the tax rate of Kanmotsu) fixed the tax rate of the Kanmotsu at 'Danbetsu santo' (54 lit. of rice per 10a) in the mid 11th century, by which Kanmotsu increasingly assumed the characteristics of land tax.
sen.cmt: 11th とアラビア数字にしました。

sen.j: 荘園公領制の展開に伴って荘園領主への貢納のうち、国衙領でいう官物にあたるものが年貢と呼ばれるようになる。
sen.e: Following the development of the Shoen-koryo-sei (system of Public Lands and Private Estates), a part of tribute paid to the lord of the manor, which was equivalent to the Kanmotsu for Kokuga-ryo (territories governed by provincial government office), was called Nengu (land tax).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Following the development of the Shoen-koryo-sei (system of Public Lands and Private Estates), a part of the tribute paid to the lord of the manor, which was equivalent to the Kanmotsu for Kokuga-ryo (territories governed by provincial government office), was called Nengu (land tax).

Following the development of the shoen koryo sei (system of public lands and private estates), a part of the tribute paid to the lord of shoen (manor in medieval Japan), which was equivalent to the Kanmotsu for kokuga-ryo (territories governed by provincial government office), was called Nengu (land tax).
sen.cmt: 荘園 補足を追加しました。

sen.j: 一方、在地領主・富豪・有力百姓らが新たな支配層として台頭していた。
sen.e: Meanwhile, resident landholders, rich people, influential farmers and others had gained power as the new ruling class.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Meanwhile, resident landholders, rich people, influential farmers and others had gained power as the new ruling class.
Meanwhile, resident landholders, rich people, influential farmers and others had gained power as the new ruling class.

sen.j: 彼らによる私出挙は、私的租税の一つとして存続していた。
sen.e: The Shi-Suiko managed by them had been maintained as private land tax.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The Shi-Suiko managed by them had been maintained as private land tax.
The Shi-Suiko managed by them had been maintained as private land tax.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代ごろから貨幣経済が発達していくと、それまでの稲の出挙ではなく、金銭の出挙が行われるようになった。
sen.e: With the development of the monetary economy since around the Kamakura period, Suiko came to be implemented by using money, instead of the conventional Suiko implemented by using rice.
With the development of a monetary economy since around the Kamakura period, Suiko came to be implemented by using money, instead of the conventional Suiko implemented by using rice.
With the development of a monetary economy since around the Kamakura period, Suiko came to be implemented by using money, instead of the conventional Suiko implemented by using rice.

sen.j: これを利銭出挙（りせんすいこ）という。
sen.e: This is called Risen-Suiko (literally, Suiko using money).
This is called Risen-Suiko (literally, Suiko using money).
This is called Risen-Suiko (literally, Suiko using money).

sen.j: 中世においても、出挙は、単なる利子付き貸借にとどまらず、租税という面も持っていた。
sen.e: In the medieval Japan as well, Suiko had characteristics not only of loaning but also of land tax.
In the medieval Japan as well, Suiko had characteristics not only of loaning but also of land tax.
In the medieval Japan as well, Suiko had characteristics not only of loaning but also of land tax.

sen.j: これはすなわち、出挙を行えるのは支配層に限られていたこと、支配層も自らが支配する範囲内でのみ出挙を行えたこと、を表している。
sen.e: These characteristics namely suggested the fact that the only ruling class could implement the Suiko, as well as the ruling class could implement the Suiko within the regions that they ruled.
These characteristics namely suggested the fact that only the ruling class could implement Suiko, as well as the ruling class could implement Suiko within the regions that they ruled.
These characteristics namely suggested the fact that only the ruling class could implement Suiko, as well as the ruling class could implement Suiko within the regions that they ruled.

sen.j: 貨幣経済の進展によって出現したのは利銭出挙だけではなかった。
sen.e: The development of the monetary economy produced not only the Risen-Suiko.
The development of the monetary economy produced not only the Risen-Suiko.
The development of the monetary economy produced not only the Risen-Suiko.

sen.j: 純粋な商行為である貸付金融も生まれることとなった。
sen.e: The money-lending system was also produced, which engaged in the pure commercial transaction.
The money-lending system was also produced, which engaged in pure commercial transaction.
The money-lending system was also produced, which engaged in pure commercial transaction.

sen.j: 鎌倉後期ごろから次第に貸付金融が主流となっていき、室町時代ごろに利銭出挙は消滅した。
sen.e: The money-lending system gradually became the leading system from around the late Kamakura period, which led the Risen-Suiko into abolishment in the Muromachi period.
The money-lending system gradually became the leading system from around the late Kamakura period, which led to the abolishment of Risen-Suiko in the Muromachi period.
The money-lending system gradually became the leading system from around the late Kamakura period, which led to the abolishment of Risen-Suiko in the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 利稲出挙は、中世後期になっても存続していた。
sen.e: However, the Rito-Suiko (Suiko managed by using rice plant) remained even in the late medieval period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, the Rito-Suiko (Suiko managed by using rice plant) remained even in the late medieval period.
However, the Rito-Suiko (Suiko managed by using rice plant) remained even in the late medieval period.

sen.j: 戦国時代 (日本)の史料に出挙の記事のあることが知られている。
sen.e: It is known that there is an article on Suiko in the historical materials compiled in the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It is known that there is an article on Suiko in the historical materials compiled in the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
It is known that there is an article on Suiko in the historical materials compiled in the Sengoku period (period of warring states) (Japan).

sen.j: しかし、安土桃山時代になると、太閤検地などを通じて土地所有関係が大きく整理されたため、出挙は近世に入るまでに消滅したとされている。
sen.e: However, after the several matters relating to the land ownership were drastically controlled through Taiko-kenchi (the land surveys conducted by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI) and other system in the Azuchi Momoyama period, Suiko is believed to have been abolished by the beginning of the early-modern times

However, after the several matters relating to land ownership were drastically controlled through Taiko-kenchi (the land surveys conducted by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI) and other systems in the Azuchi Momoyama period, Suiko is believed to have been abolished by the beginning of the early-modern times.

However, after the several matters relating to land ownership were drastically controlled through Taiko-kenchi (the land surveys conducted by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI) and other systems in the Azuchi-Momoyama period, Suiko is believed to have been abolished by the beginning of the early-modern times.
sen.cmt: Azuchi-Momoyama period とハイフンを追加しました。
